1.name: Federal
1.scope: All F-1 and J-1 international students

2.name: School
2.description: SEAS school policies override GSAS for SEAS departments
2.scope: PhD students in SEAS departments (e.g., Computer Science)

3.name: University
3.description: Graduate school policies - default for non-SEAS departments
3.scope: All PhD programs in Arts and Sciences

explicit_overrides.statement: SEAS rules override GSAS rules for PhD students whose home department is in SEAS
SEAS rules contradict and override the GSAS rules for M&F registration

conflicts.description: GSAS confers degree, but SEAS administers for engineering programs
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS departments: SEAS administers. For A&S departments: GSAS administers. GSAS always confers final degree.

conflicts.description: Different prospectus/proposal deadlines: May 31 year 4 (GSAS) vs 8th semester (PhD_SEAS)
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS students: 8th semester deadline applies. For A&S students: May 31 year 4 applies.

conflicts.description: Distribution semester is last registration vs full-time enrollment requirement for international students
conflicts.resolution_logic: ISSO rules take precedence. International students must maintain full-time status per federal law.

conflicts.description: GSAS requires closed defense. PhD_SEAS requires public seminar before defense.
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS students: Public seminar immediately before closed defense. Both requirements apply sequentially.

conflicts.description: Reduced course load final term exception vs academic program minimum registration requirements
conflicts.resolution_logic: If academic program requires minimum registration every term, that overrides RCL exception. Check program-specific rules.

conflicts.description: Travel signature validity: 12 months normally, but only 6 months during OPT
Must leave US in 15 days after LOA approval vs academic semester schedules
conflicts.resolution_logic: Federal law takes precedence. Student must leave within 15 days regardless of semester timing.

conflicts.description: Candidacy exam (6th semester) vs prospectus timing (4th year)
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS: Candidacy by 6th semester, then proposal by 8th semester. Different milestone names for same progression.

conflicts.description: SEAS requires exactly 15 points. ISSO requires 12 points minimum or 1 RU for full-time.
conflicts.resolution_logic: 15 points satisfies both requirements (15 > 12). No actual conflict.

conflicts.description: RU system (GSAS) vs point system (SEAS) for registration
conflicts.resolution_logic: MS/PhD students use point system. After completing MS, switch to RU system. Different stages use different systems.

conflicts.description: Extended Residence eligibility: GSAS allows M&F in some cases, SEAS restricts
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS students: SEAS rules apply - M&F restricted. For A&S students: GSAS rules apply - M&F more flexible.

conflicts.description: M&F registration rules: SEAS explicitly overrides GSAS
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS students: SEAS M&F rules apply. More restrictive than GSAS (no TA/RA, no courses, last 2 semesters only).

conflicts.description: Summer registration normally optional, but required if distributing dissertation in summer
conflicts.resolution_logic: Exception to general rule. If distributing in summer: must register. Otherwise: summer optional.

conflicts.description: Defense registration requirements: US citizens vs international students
conflicts.resolution_logic: All students: Must register for distribution semester. International students: Consult ISSO for defense/deposit semesters (may need to remain registered per visa requirements).

conflicts.description: Defense application timing: GSAS requires 2-4 weeks notice. PhD_SEAS requires 6 weeks for public seminar.
conflicts.resolution_logic: For SEAS students: Follow 6-week requirement (more restrictive). For A&S students: 2-4 weeks sufficient.
